title: Isolate the Quadratic term
text: We add $$8$$ on both sides to get $$3{\left(b+3\right)}^2$$ isolated by itself which gives $$3{\left(b+3\right)}^2=96$$.
speech: We add  8  on both sides to get  3 times, parentheses b plus 3,  squared  isolated by itself which gives  3 times, parentheses b plus 3,  squared is equal to 96 .

title: Find Leading Coefficient
pacedSpeech: What's the leading coefficient now?

title: Make the Leading Coefficient "1"
text: Divide by the leading coefficient on both sides which gives $${\left(b+3\right)}^2=32$$.
speech: Divide by the leading coefficient on both sides which gives  parentheses b plus 3,  squared is equal to 32 .
pacedSpeech: Divide by the leading coefficient on both sides which gives    b plus 3,  squared is equal to 32

title: Use Square Root Property
text: The square root property: if $$x^2$$ $$=$$ k, then $$x$$ $$=$$ $$\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=\sqrt{k}$$. $${\left(b+3\right)}^2=32$$, we can take square root both sides and get $$b+3=\sqrt{32}$$ or $$b+3=-\sqrt{32}$$

title: Final Answer
text: Therefore, $$3{\left(b+3\right)}^2-8$$ $$=88$$ has two solutions which are $$b=-4\sqrt{2}-3$$, and $$b=4\sqrt{2}-3$$.
speech: Therefore,  3 times, parentheses b plus 3,  squared minus 8   is equal to 88  has two solutions which are  b, is equal to negative 4 the square root of 2 minus 3 , and  b is equal to, 4 the square root of 2 minus 3 .
